column4: I installed RHEL 5.4, then installed Ubuntu 10.04. Now am not able to see RHEL in the startup menu...
How to add the RHEL boot loader in Ubuntu?....
you don't want to do that, as it will cause problems with kernel updates in ubuntu
because the ubuntu grub has overwritten the redhat applied one
if you do an update-grub2 in ubuntu it may find and dicovery the redhat os - but I doubt it
Ubuntu 10.04 has GRUB2 in it default, i believe...
so..  do i need to update grub2 again?...
no - I've just told you what to do
let me restart pc, catch u then...
still no go...  how to do that manually?...
ubottu has just send you a pm with a grub wiki page, it explains how to manually add an entry, it's worth using the menu.lst file from your Red Hat install (it's in /boot/grub on your redhat machine)
got that...  letme go thru & try that... thanks...
